title: Can someone give me a creative title on global warming? - Quora

response.answer_text: “How to build your own man made hurricane”, “Climate - weather - you like it or not”, “Stop breathing - save the planet!”, “making glaciers great again!”, “King Kanute 2: stop sea level increase”, “Dating Hot models - can you project?”, “Forget measured data - models are more fun!”, “How to contain uncertainty with ideology”, “Playboy: 97% of all climate scientists are into modelling”, “Look silly, copy/paste Skeptical Science strawmen”, “We have only x years/months/hours/seconds left before - tipping point/catastrophic climate/disaster/the end/apocalypse/the return of superman, will occur”, “reasoning regarding really robust retarded reality: renewables”, “this is not the end. Not even the beginning of the end but perhaps the end of the beginning if we don’t mitigate and repent NOW!”, “Climate change? Denial 112 for real observations”,“the data are in the Cloud”, “every drop counts: extreme weather posing as climate”.”may the forcings be with you: the rise of the global warming”. If you choose to use any of these suggested titles, please consider a small contribution to the Exxon Fossil fuel foundation/Humour section. Update: wot? 1.8k looks and not one single upvote. Must be some sort of record. No humour in this world? Update2: 2.9k looks and three upvotes. Some activists are taking themselves too seriously.

None so Blind - from ‘there are none so blind as those who will not see” Upton’s Razor - From Upton Sinclair quote “It is difficult to get a man to understand something when his salary depends upon his not understanding it.” Beyond the Horizon - Global warming’s impacts are slow — beyond normal human planning horizons — and will be mostly felt directly by people in the developing world or seaside communities — beyond the actual physical horizon for most people. Dunning the Krugers - From the Dunning-Kruger Effect, a cognitive bias in which low-ability individuals suffer from illusory superiority, mistakenly assessing their ability as much higher than it really is. Very common affliction in climate change deniers. Boiling the Frog - From the classic anecdote about putting a frog in cold water and raising the temperature slowly until it boils to death. Likely overused. Wet feet - From sea level rise. Denial: not just a river in Egypt - From the classic pun. Venality, ignorance and selfishness: Life inside bubbles of climate change denial - From the forces typically driving deniers.  Like my content? Help it spread via Patreon. Get confidential consulting via OnFrontiers. Email me if you’d like me to write for you.

Taking selfies on train tracks: Dangerous new trend is ending lives It would seem that when standing on a train track taking a selfie, humans can not actually hear the danger approaching behind them. I think that's the situation we are in present day with global warming. We stand with our backs to it, even those self aware of it. I wonder if there is a title that can capture that phenomenon. “Standing in the tracks of global warming” “With our backs to global warming”

Be my guest, take your pic; “Environmental Degradation” “Climate Trauma” “Climate Apocalypse” “Climate Disruption” “Climate Catastrophe” “Climate Predicament” “Climate Emergency” “Climate Crisis” “Climate Change” “Climate Problem” “Climate Change Crisis” “Global Warming” “Global Climate Change” “Extreme Climate” “Climate Breakdown” “Ecological Devastation” “Environmental Destruction” “Ecological Collapse” ----------What scary name shall we use tomorrow?

I can’t take credit for this one, it’s on a T-shirt that I was given: The Truth is Cool If you don’t “get it,” here are some sources where you can learn more about climate change:http://tinyurl.com/learnmore4 tl;dr version: the best evidence is that manmade climate change is modest and benign, and CO2 emissions are beneficial, rather than harmful.
“The REAL inconvenient truth: Scientist claims global warming is NATURAL” suite on creative also in trending articles tell me that why you need ? for essay, Assignment or Article Writing?
